metadata.title: CVE-2021-23982 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Using techniques that built on the slipstream research, a malicious webpagecould have scanned both an internal network's hosts as well as servicesrunning on the user's local machine utilizing WebRTC connections. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.9, Firefox < 87, and Thunderbird <78.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23982` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 87.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '87.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.11.0+build1-0ubuntu2').
